slip_stitch in first single_crochet 24 spaces abbreviations & terms chain crochet chain counted in number of loops not including any on the hook double_crochet double_crochet stitch magic loop a replacement for the usual foundation loop of chain stitches single_crochet single_crochet stitch slip_stitch slip_stitch pm place marker ** after working once repeat everything inside a given number of times crochet net produce sack pattern by janine paris​ | ​4 ​of​ 6 body chain 5 single_crochet into next space pm into the space you just made *chain 5 single_crochet into next space * repeat around for 24 row using the marker to judge roughly where the rounds begin and end it s not necessary to know precisely where the beginning and end of the rounds are you don t need to move the marker as you work the body unless you prefer to top and finishing 1 c​ h 4 single_crochet into next space repeat around 2 c​ h 3 single_crochet into next space repeat around 3 c​ h 2 single_crochet into next space repeat around 4 c​ h 20 join to first chain with slip_stitch break yarn with at least 4 tail 5 w​ eave in ends and enjoy crochet net produce sack pattern by janine paris​ | ​5 ​of​ 6 bag base worked to the end of round 10 and beginning of the bag body the first chain 5 space has been worked and the marker placed crochet net produce sack pattern by janine paris​ | ​6 ​of​ 6 base
